title: Executive Order Addressing Threats to the United States by the Government of Cuba
summary: The action, issued by the President, invokes the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and the National Emergencies Act, along with authority under 3 U.S.C. 301, to determine and implement measures in response to threats purportedly posed by the Government of Cuba. The order begins with Section 1 outlining the initial directive, and authorizes further actions to be taken under the stated statutes to address the identified threats.

title: Executive Order Addressing Addiction through the Great American Recovery Initiative
summary: An executive order issued by the President under constitutional authority that states the purpose and policy to address substance use disorder (addiction) as a national crisis affecting families and communities, notes that approximately 48.4 million people are affected, and establishes the Great American Recovery Initiative as the framework for federal action to address the crisis.

title: Proclamation by the President Declaring the Year of Celebration and Rededication, 2026
summary: This proclamation announces a year-long observance starting January 1, 2026 to commemorate the United States' 250th anniversary of independence since 1776. It designates 2026 as the Year of Celebration and Rededication and outlines the objective to recognize the nationâ€™s history and freedom through related observances and activities coordinated by the executive branch.

title: Addressing State and Local Failures to Rebuild Los Angeles After Wildfire Disasters
summary: This presidential action, issued under the President's constitutional and legal authority, addresses what is described as failures by California state and Los Angeles city and county governments to contain wildfires and to rebuild after wildfire disasters. It notes that about one year earlier wildfires ravaged the Los Angeles area, destroying or damaging homes and businesses across roughly 40,000 acres. The action sets forth objectives to respond to these failures and to coordinate federal support for reconstruction, disaster response, and rebuilding planning in the affected region.

title: Presidential Order Continuation of the Federal Emergency Management Agency Review Council
summary: This Executive Order continues the Federal Emergency Management Agency Review Council, an advisory committee originally established by a prior action. The order directs that the Council shall continue to operate under the framework of the Federal Advisory Committee Act and shall advise the Federal Emergency Management Agency on matters related to its programs and activities in emergency management and related areas. The action ensures the Council's continuation and maintains its governance and oversight responsibilities in accordance with applicable statutes and regulations, facilitating ongoing review and recommendations to improve FEMA's effectiveness and coordination in emergency management efforts.

title: Proclamation on Martin Luther King Jr. Federal Holiday, 2026
summary: This proclamation designates Martin Luther King Jr. Federal Holiday for 2026 and describes the observance as an occasion to recognize Dr. King's leadership in advancing civil rights and justice. It references the Declaration of Independence as the source of the nation's fundamental ideals and renews the government's commitment to equality and opportunity. The document outlines the intended observance and the federal government's role in recognizing the holiday.
